title: How does UK's measles immunisation coverage compare internationally?
analysis_commentary:
Between 2000 and 2004 the UK measles vaccination rate declined â€“ falling from 88% to 81% over this period. From 2004 to 2014 the rate increased to 93%. The decline between 2000 and 2004 was likely due to safety concerns relating to measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccine. In 2014, Portugal had the highest measles immunisations coverage (98%) whilst Italy had the lowest (86%). Immunisation coverage levels increased between 2000 and 2014 in the majority of countries.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Data
